  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main function runs a loop that displays either a login menu or a main menu based on whether the user is verified or not.

    • showLoginMenu

      public int showLoginMenu()
      This function displays a login menu, validates and returns the user's selected option as an integer.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which is the user's selected option from the login menu.

    • getOptionShowMenuBibliographic

      public int getOptionShowMenuBibliographic()
      This Java function gets an integer option for displaying a bibliographic product menu after printing the menu.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which is the option selected by the user from the bibliographic product menu.

    • getOptionReports

      public int getOptionReports()
      This function gets an integer option from the user after displaying a bibliographic product menu.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which is the validated option selected by the user from the bibliographic product menu.

    • showMainMenu

      public int showMainMenu()
      This function displays a main menu and returns the user's validated integer option.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which is the user's selected option from the main menu.

    • showMenuReports

      public int showMenuReports()
      This function displays a menu of reports and returns the user's selected option as an integer.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which is the user's selected option from the report menu.

    • loginMenu

      public String loginMenu()
      The function returns a string containing a login menu with options for logging in, registering a user, managing bibliographical products, generating reports, or exiting the program.
      Returns:
      A string that represents a login menu with options for logging in, registering a user, managing bibliographical products, generating reports, and exiting the program.

    • executeLoginMenuOption

      public void executeLoginMenuOption(int option)
      This function executes different options based on the input parameter, including login, user registration, bibliographic menu, report menu, and program exit.
      Parameters:
      option - an integer representing the user's selected option from a login menu. It is used in a switch statement to determine which action to take.

    • login

      public void login()
      This function prompts the user to enter their user ID, verifies if the ID exists in the system, and displays a welcome message if the user is found or an error message if the user is not found.

    • mainMenu

      public String mainMenu()
      The function returns a string that displays the main menu options for a program related to buying books, subscribing to magazines, viewing a library, and logging out/exiting the program.
      Returns:
      A string that represents the main menu of a program, which includes options to buy a book, subscribe to a magazine, view the library, or logout and exit the program.

    • executeMainMenuOption

      public void executeMainMenuOption(int option)
      The function executes a main menu option based on the input option number.
      Parameters:
      option - The option selected by the user from the main menu. It is an integer value that determines which action to perform.

    • bibliographicProductMenu

      public String bibliographicProductMenu()
      This function returns a string that displays a menu for managing bibliographic products such as books and magazines.
      Returns:
      A string that represents a menu for managing bibliographic products, including options to add books and magazines, modify and delete resources, and return to the main menu.

    • executeOptionBibliographic

      public void executeOptionBibliographic(int option)
      This function executes different options related to bibliographic resources based on the user's input.
      Parameters:
      option - an integer representing the user's selected option in a bibliographic system menu. The method executes different actions based on the value of this option.

    • reportMenu

      public String reportMenu()
      The function returns a string containing the main menu options for a platform and its features.
      Returns:
      A string that represents the main menu of a platform with different options such as cumulative total number of pages read, most read book genre and magazine category, top 5 books and top 5 most read magazines, number of books sold and total sales value by genre, number of active subscriptions and the total value paid for subscriptions by category, and an option to logout and exit the program.

    • executeReportMenuOption

      public void executeReportMenuOption(int option)
      This function executes a report menu option based on the user's input.
      Parameters:
      option - an integer representing the user's selected option from a report menu. The method executes a specific report generation method based on the selected option. If the option is not valid, an error message is displayed.

    • validateIntegerOption

      public int validateIntegerOption()
      This function validates an integer input from the user and returns it, or returns -1 if the input is not an integer.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which could be either the integer value entered by the user or -1 if the user did not enter a valid integer.

    • registerUser

      public void registerUser()
      This function registers a new user by taking input for their name, ID, and user type, and adding them to the system if their ID is unique.

    • registerBook

      public void registerBook()
      This function registers a new book by prompting the user to input various details such as the book's ID, name, number of pages, genre, publication date, cover URL, sale value, and review.

    • registerMagazine

      public void registerMagazine()
      This function registers a new magazine by prompting the user to input various details and validating the input before adding it to the system.

    • deleteResource

      public void deleteResource()
      This Java function prompts the user to enter the ID of a resource to be deleted and then calls a controller method to remove the resource.

    • validateDate

      public Calendar validateDate()
      This function prompts the user to enter a publication date and validates it before returning a Calendar object.
      Returns:
      A Calendar object is being returned.

    • validerIntegerInput

      public static int validerIntegerInput(Scanner reader)
      This function validates user input to ensure it is an integer and prompts the user to enter a valid integer if the input is invalid.
      Parameters:
      reader - A Scanner object used to read input from the user.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value.

    • validerDoubleInput

      public static double validerDoubleInput(Scanner reader)
      This Java function validates and returns a double input from the user using a Scanner object.
      Parameters:
      reader - The parameter "reader" is a Scanner object that is used to read input from the user. It is passed as an argument to the method "validerDoubleInput" so that the method can read and validate the user's input.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a double value that is entered by the user through the Scanner object.

    • modifyResource

      public void modifyResource()
      This Java function allows the user to modify a bibliographic resource by selecting which attribute to modify and entering the new value.

    • buyBook

      public void buyBook()
      This function allows a user to buy a book by entering its code or name, generates a bill, and updates the book's sales information.

    • subscribeToMagazine

      public void subscribeToMagazine()
      This function allows a user to subscribe to a magazine by entering the magazine code, generating a bill, and verifying payment.

    • viewLibrary

      public void viewLibrary()
      This function displays the library and allows the user to navigate through it using various commands.
